Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: EDs are such tortuous and torturous things. I actually finally felt neutral my body at my LW (bmi 16)...like, I was ok just sitting there. *But* my heart was giving out, grey-outs were par for the course (I got really good at memorizing rooms before I stood up so that I could walk blind for 5 seconds or so), my period had stopped so bone density loss was looming. And still my brain would Not. Shut. Up. Incessant counting and calculating and checking and worrying.   I’ve got a GW now that’s above that teenaged LW, so you best believe I’m doubling down on the ‘this is fine’ delusion. Nothin like a disorder that’s killing you while whispering it’s saving you. Nothin like constructing your own hell and telling yourself it will be paradise. I mean, not now of course, but soon.
